<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_finish_threads:
```c
void metal_finish_threads(int threads, void *tids)
{
	int i;
	pthread_t *tid_p = (pthread_t *)tids;

	if (!tids) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "invalid argument, tids is NULL.\n");
		return;
	}

	for (i = 0; i < threads; i++)
		(void)pthread_join(tid_p[i], NULL);
}
```
</target_code>

	int ts_created;
	pthread_t tids[THREADS];

	/** TC1 consumer threads go first */

	ret = metal_run_noblock(THREADS, consumer_thread, NULL, tids,

		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to create producer thread: %d.\n",

	/** wait for consumer threads to finish */
	metal_finish_threads(THREADS, (void *)tids);

	ret = metal_run_noblock(THREADS, producer_thread, NULL, tids,

		goto out;

	/** create 10 consumer threads next */
	ret = metal_run(THREADS, consumer_thread, NULL);
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to create producer thread: %d.\n",

		goto out;

out:

	metal_finish_threads(THREADS, (void *)tids);

int metal_run_noblock(int threads, metal_thread_t child,
		     void *arg, void *tids, int *threads_out)
{
	int error, i;
	pthread_t *tid_p = (pthread_t *)tids;

	if (!tids) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "invalid argument, tids is NULL.\n");
		return -EINVAL;
	}

	error = 0;
	for (i = 0; i < threads; i++) {
		error = -pthread_create(&tid_p[i], NULL, child, arg);
		if (error) {
			metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "failed to create thread - %s\n",
				  strerror(error));
			break;
		}
	}

	*threads_out = i;
	return error;
}

{
	const int threads = 10;
	atomic_int counter = ATOMIC_VAR_INIT(0);
	int value, error;

	error = metal_run(threads, atomic_thread, &counter);
	if (!error) {
		value = atomic_load(&counter);
		value -= atomic_test_count * threads;
		if (value) {
			metal_log(METAL_LOG_DEBUG, "counter mismatch, delta = %d\n",
				  value);
			error = -EINVAL;
		}
	}

	return error;

scenario: No violation in the provided code. metal_finish_threads calls metal_log and pthread_join only; it does not call itself directly nor via another function in the given code. A concrete indirect-violation example (hypothetical) would be: metal_finish_threads() calls metal_run(), and metal_run() calls metal_finish_threads() — that call chain would create indirect recursion and violate Rule 17.2.
